greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least positive integer k < n with k!*(n-k) + 1 prime, or 0 if such an integer k does not exist.
comment: Conjecture: 0 < a(n) < sqrt(n)*(log n) for all n > 2.
See also the conjecture in A231516.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(4) = 2 since 1!*3 + 1 = 4 is not prime, but 2!*2 + 1 = 5 is prime.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Nov 11 2013
